title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MILWAUKEE — On a night where every possession crackled with playoff intensity, one man transcended the game itself. Gheorghe Muresan, the 7'7" center from Romania, didn't just play basketball; he authored a historic, dominant masterpiece that single-handedly carried the Washington Bullets to a gritty 95-90 road victory over the Milwaukee Bucks.

The story was written in the paint, where Muresan was simply unstoppable. He poured in a colossal 50 points, a figure so immense it dwarfed all other narratives. Each of his 18 made field goals was a hammer blow to the Bucks' defense, which had no answer for his unique combination of size and soft touch. Muresan completed his legendary night with 14 rebounds, a towering presence on both ends of the floor that cemented his complete dominance.

While Glenn Robinson fought valiantly for Milwaukee, leading his squad with 24 points, his effort was merely a subplot to the Muresan showcase. The Bullets' supporting cast understood their role was to feed the giant, and the strategy paid off with a crucial road win.

In the annals of NBA history, 50-point games are rare landmarks. For Gheorghe Muresan, this was more than just a personal triumph; it was a statement performance that showcased his immense talent in its purest form. On this night in Milwaukee, the Bullets didn't just win a game—they rode the back of a basketball titan into the record books.
